Posts.Content: kellysmum wrote: I have a lump (which I cannot see or feel) in my right breast (found by mammography).  I have a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound Wednesday morning.  The girl who made the appointment said the radiologist would be there and read the test immediately.  How long do I wait before they tell me?  What has your experience been?  Thank you for any replies. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How long after ultrasound for results? kellysmum helou

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2012 12:36PM kellysmum wrote: I just have a family history and an oncologogist and gynecologist who told me I had a very, very high chance of carrying it.  In fact, the oncologist told me I should have my ovaries removed now.  So I guess I always assumed I had it.
Posts.Title: Mammogram found nodule right breast-have BRAC gene-worried kellysmum indiosbaby

Posts.Content: kellysmum wrote: I had my ultrasound yesterday for the lump that was found in my mammogram in my right breast.  The radiologist read it as a cyst (it was black on the ultrasound, showing it was fluid-filled).  I was so relieved!  The radiologist said my doctor may want me to have a six-month mammogram to watch the cyst.  Anyway, I want to thank everyone here who responded to my posts looking for answers, and for your kindness and support.  Many blessings. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: It was just a cyst! kellysmum Beesie

Posts.Content: kellysmum wrote: I am 47 years old with an extremely strong history of breast cancer among all my female relatives, including my mother, both grandmothers, and aunts.  My maternal grandmother had breast cancer in her 50's, the rest in their 70's.  I had a screening mammogram on Tuesday and got the phone call yesterday morning that I have a "nodule" in my right breast.  I am scheduled for a diagnostic mammography and ultrasound for this coming Wednesday morning at the hospital.  I am scared out of my mind.  I have felt my right breast, but feel no lump.  No lumps under my right armpit, either.  Will I get the results of the ultrasound and mammography immediately on Wednesday morning while I'm there, or will I have to wait? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mammogram found nodule right breast-have BRAC gene-worried kellysmum indiosbaby
